items.title: 50 rising startups in Israel
Crypto exchange Kraken plans 2026 IPO
items.summary:
- Kraken plans to go public in Q1 2026 as US regulatory conditions improve.
- The SEC recently dropped its case against Kraken without charges.
- Kraken reported 2024 revenue exceeding $1.5 billion with adjusted earnings of $380 million.
- Ranked 10th largest crypto exchange by trading volume, joining others exploring IPOs as the market recovers.
- Founded in 2011, Kraken has raised about $27 million in primary funding.

items.title: Nazara sells major gaming stake for $11.9m deal
items.summary:
- Nazara Technologies sells 94.85% stake in OpenPlay Technologies to Moonshine Technology for approximately $11.97 million.
- Deal involves issuing 199,890 compulsory convertible preference shares at $0.11 each.
- Moonshine acquires OpenPlay’s rummy platform, enhancing its real money gaming portfolio.
- OpenPlay’s ClassicRummy will also become a subsidiary of Moonshine.
- Nazara's board also approved a $250,000 investment in ReelSaga Innovations for a 3.57% equity stake.

items.title: Dubai delivery app acquires marketplace instashop for $32m
items.summary:
- Kuwait-based delivery platform talabat has acquired 100% of instashop from Delivery Hero SE for US$32 million, finalizing the deal in March 2025.
- Instashop will remain a standalone brand within talabat’s grocery and retail division.
- Founded in 2015 in the UAE, instashop operates in the UAE, Bahrain, Egypt, Lebanon, and Qatar.
- Instashop reported an annual gross merchandise volume of US$631 million in 2024, a 16% increase from the previous year.
- This acquisition strengthens talabat’s grocery and retail offerings in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region.
- Instashop’s operations will integrate with talabat’s structure while maintaining brand independence.

items.title: Trump softens stance on Taiwan after TSMC’s $100b investment
items.summary:
- US President Donald Trump softened his stance on Taiwan's semiconductor industry following TSMC's announcement of a US$100 billion investment in the US.
- He acknowledged Taiwan's leadership in the sector, attributing it to past US policies while criticizing previous tariffs on Taiwanese imports.
- TSMC plans to build five advanced chip plants in Arizona, expected to strengthen the US semiconductor industry and reflect shifts in global supply chains.

items.title: Taiwan-based Meta cloud supplier boosts 2025 investment to $548m
items.summary:
- Wiwynn Corp increases its 2025 capital expenditure to NT$18 billion (US$548 million) amid higher US tariffs on Mexican imports.
- The budget supports a US$300 million factory in Texas, a new facility in Kaohsiung, and expansions in Mexico and Malaysia.
- CFO Harry Chen states Texas facility provides flexibility for clients affected by tariffs, without replacing operations in Mexico.
- Some clients have moved production to Wiwynn’s plants in the Czech Republic or Malaysia.
- In February 2025, Wiwynn reported NT$46.51 billion in revenue, a 91.22% year-over-year increase, with total revenue for the first two months at NT$84.02 billion.
- Wiwynn anticipates growing demand for AI and general-purpose servers due to investments from cloud giants like Meta and Microsoft.
- The company plans to start shipping AI servers powered by Nvidia chips later this quarter.

items.title: Capital SEA: Southeast Asia’s funding landscape
items.author: Terence Lee, Yeo Cheng Yong
items.summary:
- The article explores recent funding trends and investors in Southeast Asia.
- It is divided into two main sections: **weekly update** for recent data and **macro trends** for an overarching view of funding across various sectors.
- Notable investors and companies in the region are highlighted, emphasizing the shifts in investment patterns.

items.title: Indian state offers $799m incentives to Foxconn
items.summary:
- Karnataka's Chief Minister Siddaramaiah announced incentives worth ₹6,970 crore (US$799.4 million) for Foxconn on March 7, 2025.
- The incentives will facilitate the establishment of a smartphone manufacturing plant in Devanahalli Industrial Area with a projected investment of ₹21,911 crore (US$2.51 billion).
- The facility will occupy 300 acres in Bengaluru Rural district and aims to create 500,000 jobs while supporting deeptech startups under the Local Economy Accelerator Programme (LEAP).

items.title: Musk to face questioning over Twitter acquisition
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Elon Musk will be questioned regarding his acquisition of Twitter.
- The questioning is part of ongoing investigations into the deal.
- This scrutiny reflects broader concerns around social media ownership and influence.

items.title: A16z-backed AI developer firm in talks for $10b valuation
items.summary:
- Anysphere Inc. seeks to raise several hundred million dollars in funding.
- The funding round could value the company at nearly US$10 billion, up from US$2.5 billion in January.
- Anysphere has achieved over US$100 million in annual recurring revenue within the last year and secured around US$175 million in venture capital, including investments from Andreessen Horowitz.
- The funding would indicate robust investor interest in AI-powered tools like coding assistants and chatbots.
- No comments from Thrive Capital or Anysphere regarding the negotiations.

items.title: Tesla stock hits 7-week slump, loses over $800b value
items.summary:
- Tesla’s stock has declined for seven consecutive weeks, reaching a closing price of US$270.48 on Mar. 7, the lowest since Nov. 5.
- The market capitalization has fallen by over US$800 billion since peaking at nearly US$480 on Dec. 17.
- Wall Street firms like Bank of America and Goldman Sachs lowered their price targets due to weaker sales and competition in China.
- Production issues related to the Model Y transition are contributing to the slump.
- Concerns regarding Elon Musk’s political engagements and public remarks have negatively affected sentiment.
- Despite challenges, some analysts remain optimistic; Wedbush Securities maintains a US$550 price target for Tesla.

items.title: DeepSeek’s rise sparks AI market shake-up
items.summary:
- DeepSeek launched its app on Jan. 20, 2025, offering a low-cost large language model for free.
- It became the most downloaded freeware app on the US iOS App Store within two days, surpassing OpenAI’s ChatGPT.
- The launch coincided with the World Economic Forum in Davos, attracting global investor interest.
- CEO Bonnie Chan Yiting noted it led to a reassessment of Chinese tech stocks and improved investor confidence.
- Nvidia’s stocks dropped 17% on Jan. 27, losing US$600 billion in value as investors reconsidered tech valuations against DeepSeek's model.
- The decline continued with an additional 4% drop, indicating a shift in market dynamics favoring Chinese AI firms.

items.title: Microsoft develops new AI models to compete with OpenAI
items.summary:
- Microsoft has developed proprietary AI models called "MAI" to compete with OpenAI and Anthropic.
- These models are being evaluated for use in Microsoft’s Copilot AI assistants.
- The company is also working on "reasoning models" to handle complex queries, an area also pursued by competitors.
- Microsoft aims to reduce its reliance on OpenAI while renegotiating their $13 billion partnership, allowing OpenAI to use other cloud providers until 2030.
- The company tests a mix of AI models, including in-house designs and options from Meta, Anthropic, and xAI.
- Microsoft’s investment in AI infrastructure includes smaller models dubbed "Phi" and aims to diversify its offerings.

items.title: US justice department drops Google AI divestment bid
items.summary:
• The US Department of Justice has withdrawn its proposal for Google to divest its AI investments, including its stake in Anthropic.
• The DOJ and 38 state attorneys general continue to pursue other measures in their antitrust case, including forcing Google to divest its Chrome browser.
• New evidence revealed potential risks of limiting Google's AI involvement; the DOJ now proposes Google report future investments in generative AI.
• Google argues that forced divestitures may weaken its AI position, benefiting rivals like OpenAI and Microsoft.
• The antitrust crackdown on Big Tech continues, with a trial set for April and other DOJ proposals still in play, such as sharing search query data with competitors.

items.title: LatAm fintech giant’s investor relation officer to step down
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Jörg Friedemann, investor relations officer at Nubank, will step down by April 2025.
- He joined Nubank in July 2022 and is leaving for another opportunity.
- Prior to Nubank, he led financial equity research for Latin America at Citigroup and held roles at Goldman Sachs, Bank of America, and UBS.
- Friedemann currently serves as Nubank’s global head of ESG and market intelligence.
- No official statements have been made by either Friedemann or Nubank regarding his departure.

items.title: US weighs DeepSeek ban on gov’t devices, sources say
items.summary:
- The US government is considering banning the Chinese AI chatbot DeepSeek from government devices due to national security concerns.
- Officials are worried about DeepSeek's data handling as user information is stored on servers in China.
- 21 state attorneys general have urged Congress to prohibit DeepSeek on government devices.
- The White House has not yet commented on the issue.
- DeepSeek gained attention in January 2025 when its low-cost AI models affected global equity markets.

items.title: US Trade Office to Hold Hearing on Chinese Semiconductor
items.summary:
- The US Trade Representative’s Office (USTR) will hold a hearing on March 11 concerning Chinese-made legacy semiconductors.
- The hearing may result in increased tariffs on these chips used in various products, including automobiles and telecom equipment.
- An investigation was launched in December 2024, focusing on concerns regarding China's state-supported semiconductor industry.
- As of January 1, 2025, a 50% tariff on Chinese semiconductors is already in place.
- A report from the Commerce Department indicates that two-thirds of US semiconductor-using products include Chinese legacy chips, with many companies unaware of their origins.
- The investigation is conducted under Section 301 of the Trade Act of 1974, previously used for tariffs on $370 billion in Chinese goods.
- Stakeholders include the China Association of Automobile Manufacturers and the Foundation for American Innovation, each presenting opposing views on subsidies.
- The hearing's results could impact US-China trade policy and the global semiconductor market.

items.title: Shift happens!
items.summary:
- Darwinbox secured US$140 million in a series E funding round co-led by Partners Group and KKR.
- Flow48 raised US$69 million in series A funding led by Breega.
- NXin received US$39.8 million in strategic funding.
- Grain locked in US$33 million in series A funding led by Bain Capital Ventures.
- Heidi Health raised US$16.6 million in series A funding.
- Digiledge was acquired by Mintoak; amount undisclosed.
- IFreedom was acquired by Boss Wallah; amount undisclosed.
- Freshreview was acquired by GaragePlug; amount undisclosed.

items.title: Meet the 50 top-funded startups and tech companies in Korea
items.summary:
- A list of the 50 Korean startups and tech companies that have raised the most money from investors.
- The funding data used is from the past two years to keep the list current.
- For additional data and research methodology, readers can access Tech in Asia's database on tech companies in Asia.

items.title: 50 rising startups in Korea
BBC launches AI unit to personalize news
items.summary:
- The BBC is establishing a new department, BBC News Growth, Innovation, and AI, to use AI for personalized news content.
- This initiative is part of a broader restructuring led by BBC News CEO Deborah Turness aimed at engaging younger audiences under 25 as news moves to digital platforms.
- The new unit will focus on AI applications like story curation based on user habits and aims to enhance news delivery, addressing challenges such as news avoidance and declining broadcast viewership.
- A new BBC Live and Daily News unit will also be launched to improve content distribution.
- A director will be appointed to oversee AI investments and audience engagement.

items.title: Ex-TSMC chairman Mark Liu joins Micron to boost AI efforts
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Mark Liu, former chairman of TSMC, has joined Micron Technology's board of directors for AI development.
- Micron’s CEO Sanjay Mehrotra highlighted Liu’s semiconductor experience as vital for AI in data centers and edge computing.
- Liu has over 30 years of experience at TSMC, significantly contributing to its growth and advanced fabrication facilities.

items.title: Taiwan stocks drop as US tariffs fuel market concerns
items.summary:
• Taiwan’s stock market closed lower on Mar. 7 due to concerns over US trade policies.
• The Taiex index fell by 139.36 points (0.61%), finishing at 22,576.07, with a turnover of NT$350.18 billion (US$10.67 billion).
• The decline followed losses in US markets, with the Dow Jones down by 0.99% and Nasdaq down by 2.61%.
• Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC) remained stable, closing at NT$1,005.00 (US$30.63).
• Foreign institutional investors sold a net NT$29.50 billion (US$898.77 million) worth of shares on Mar. 7, contributing to a weekly net sale of NT$149.70 billion (US$4.56 billion).
• Analysts anticipate ongoing market pressure as US trade policies unfold.

items.title: Trump signals possible TikTok sale deadline extension
items.summary:
- US President Donald Trump indicated he might approve an extension for TikTok's sale if no deal is reached by the April 5 deadline.
- He stated there is strong interest in TikTok and that the current timeline allows for "at least another month."
- The sale is mandated by a bipartisan law requiring ByteDance Ltd. to divest TikTok's US operations due to national security concerns.
- The original January 19 deadline was already extended by 75 days via an executive order.
- Trump raised questions about his legal authority to extend the deadline again under existing laws.

items.title: Logistics startup Shadowfax nets $7.5m from co-founders
items.author: Vaibhav Khandelwal, Abhishek Bansal
items.summary:
- Shadowfax raised 65.4 crore rupee (US$7.5 million) from co-founders on Mar. 4.
- The funding values the company at US$750 million, as part of a US$50 million financing.
- The firm has plans for an IPO in late 2025 to raise 2,500-3,000 crore rupee (US$286.73 million–344.08 million).
- Has raised over US$212 million since its founding in 2015 and operates in over 2,500 cities, serving clients like Flipkart and Meesho.
- Recent funding includes US$1.25 million from IMM India Fund and US$11.03 million in February from several investors.

items.title: A list of fundraising startups from Asia and beyond (Updated)
items.summary:
- Fundraising is challenging, prompting the creation of a list of fundraising startups for subscribers.
- Startups can sign up for listing to gain visibility among investors.
- Investors can subscribe to receive curated startup information via email.
- The article encourages readers to share their fundraising success stories with the editorial team.

items.title: Indian furniture rental startup bags $70m debt funding
items.author: Ajith Mohan Karimpana
items.summary:
- Furlenco secured ₹60 crore (US$7 million) in debt funding from Northern Arc Capital and CredAvenue.
- Funds were raised through non-convertible debentures: ₹50 crore to Northern Arc and ₹10 crore to CredAvenue.
- Founded in 2012, Furlenco offers subscription-based furniture rentals and reported a net loss of ₹130 crore (US$14.91 million) for FY 2023-24.

items.title: Trump establishes US bitcoin reserve with seized crypto
items.summary:
- US President Donald Trump signed an executive order to create a "Strategic Bitcoin Reserve" using seized cryptocurrencies.
- The reserve will include bitcoin obtained through criminal and civil asset forfeitures, with no plans for new purchases.
- A separate "US Digital Asset Stockpile" will hold other seized cryptocurrencies, also without additional acquisitions.
- Following the announcement, bitcoin prices fell 5% to US$85,000 but later recovered to US$89,200.
- Experts interpret the move as symbolic, acknowledging bitcoin as a government asset.
- Concerns include potential conflicts of interest due to Trump's family projects in cryptocurrency and his assets in World Liberty Financial, now under ethics review.

items.title: Trump hosts first White House crypto summit
items.summary:
- On Mar. 8, US President Donald Trump held the first-ever White House Crypto Summit.
- Key figures from the cryptocurrency sector attended, including Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong and Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev.
- Discussions focused on digital asset legislation, stablecoin regulation, and the bitcoin reserve framework.
- An executive order established a Strategic Bitcoin Reserve to hold bitcoin from legal forfeitures, with 200,000 bitcoin estimated for long-term asset management.
- The summit emphasizes the administration’s commitment to aligning financial innovation with US strategic interests.

items.title: Baidu seeks $2b via exchangeable bonds for Trip.com shares
items.summary:
- Baidu Inc. plans to raise up to US$2 billion through bonds exchangeable into shares of Trip.com Group Ltd.
- The seven-year bonds will mature in 2032, with a 0% coupon rate.
- Proceeds will be used for debt repayment, interest payments, and general corporate purposes.
- The offering is managed by JPMorgan Chase & Co., Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs Group Inc., and Bank of America Corp.

items.title: Apple gets local content certification in Indonesia
items.summary:
- Indonesian Industry Ministry certifies 20 Apple products, including the iPhone 16.
- Apple needs additional permits from the communications and trade ministries to sell products domestically.
- Certification follows negotiations regarding compliance with local regulations.
- Apple received certificates for 11 smartphone models and 9 tablet models.
- Apple not among the top five smartphone brands in Indonesia according to Canalyst data.

items.title: Nio secures $552m from two Chinese state-owned firms
items.summary:
- EV manufacturer Nio received a capital injection of 4 billion yuan (US$552.18 million) from two state-owned firms in Anhui Province.
- Hefei Jianxiang Investment Co., Ltd. invested 2.86 billion yuan (US$394.81 million) for a 3.46% stake, while Anhui Gaoxin Yuwun Weiyuan Technology Partnership Enterprise contributed 1.14 billion yuan (US$157.37 million) for a 1.38% stake.
- Nio's registered capital increased from 7.857 billion yuan (US$1.08 billion) to 8.257 billion yuan (US$1.14 billion), indicating ongoing local government support.
- Following the investment, Nio's shares rose 2.42% to HK$33.9 (US$4.36) per share, valuing the company at HK$70.866 billion (US$911.94 million).
- Founded by William Li, Nio has completed 16 financing rounds, raising approximately 118.7 billion yuan (US$16.39 billion) in total funding.

items.title: Oyo appoints former US head as CEO of G6 Hospitality
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Oyo has appointed Sonal Sinha as CEO of G6 Hospitality, which includes Motel 6 and Studio 6 brands in the US.
- This appointment follows Oyo's acquisition of G6 Hospitality for US$525 million from Blackstone Real Estate.
- Sinha has been with Oyo since 2015 and reported previously as the country head for the US.
- Oyo plans to invest US$10 million to enhance G6 Hospitality's digital assets.
- G6 Hospitality is expected to contribute an EBITDA of ₹630 crore (US$72.26 million) next financial year, boosting Oyo's overall EBITDA to over ₹2,000 crore (US$229.38 million) by FY26.

items.title: Taiwan’s exports surge 32% in Feb driven by AI demand
items.summary:
- Taiwan's exports surged 31.5% year-on-year in February to $41.31 billion, surpassing the 17% growth forecast.
- This marks the 16th consecutive month of rising exports, attributed to strong AI-related demand and preemptive orders due to potential US tariffs on Taiwanese chips.
- Electronic components exports rose by 24.6% to $14.44 billion, with semiconductor exports matching this increase, benefiting suppliers like TSMC from major tech clients such as Apple and Nvidia.
- Exports to the US increased by 65.6% to $11.77 billion, while exports to China grew by 27.9% after a January decline.
- Imports jumped by 47.8% to $34.76 billion, exceeding the expected growth of 19.2%.
- The Ministry of Finance warned that geopolitical risks and tariff uncertainties may affect future export trends, projecting March exports to see a change between a 1% decline and a 2% increase.

items.title: NetEase to shut down public cloud service
items.summary:
- NetEase will close its public cloud service on **April 7** due to a shift in business strategy.
- Corporate clients are advised to migrate to other platforms, with refunds for unused credits offered.
- The cloud service had operated for nearly **10 years**, but faced fierce competition from Alibaba, ByteDance, and state-owned telecoms.
- The growth of AI has exacerbated competition, where NetEase is perceived to be lagging.
- Analysts note this decision underscores NetEase's difficulties in maintaining competitiveness in China’s cloud market.

items.title: Broadcom surges 12% on AI chip revenue outlook rises
items.summary:
- Broadcom’s stock rose 12% in premarket trading on Mar. 7.
- CEO Hock Tan projected US$4.4 billion in Q2 revenue for AI semiconductor division.
- Surge driven by demand from hyperscale customers for custom AI chips.
- Broadcom benefiting from a shift away from Nvidia's expensive AI processors, with OpenAI collaborating on custom designs.
- Broader semiconductor market facing decline, with Marvell Technology shares dropping 19.8% on Mar. 6.
- Other chipmakers like Nvidia, Micron, and AMD saw minor premarket gains.
- Despite significant increases in 2024, Broadcom’s stock fell about 23% in 2025.
- 12-month forward price-to-earnings ratio for Broadcom is at 26.58, compared to Nvidia’s 23.46.

items.title: TVS Motor Acquires Ion Mobility, Strengthening Electric Mobility in ASEAN
items.author: James Chan
items.summary:
- TVS Motor has acquired Singapore-based e-scooter startup Ion Mobility.  
- The acquisition was announced by Ion Mobility's founder and CEO, James Chan, and includes all assets and intellectual property.  
- Chan will join TVS as senior vice president overseeing the ASEAN market starting April 1, 2025.  
- TVS plans to relaunch Ion's flagship electric scooter, the M1-S, with improvements and under the TVS brand.  
- Ion Mobility was founded in 2019 and struggled to continue as an independent company despite previous funding.  
- The company had a presence in Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam, and China with over 130 employees but was unable to secure additional financing.  
- Financial terms of the acquisition were not disclosed, previously reported to be 10 cents to a dollar for shareholders.

items.title: Lamudi’s parent appoints liquidator: Australian gov’t body
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Digital Classifieds Group (DCG), parent company of Lamudi, appoints a liquidator and administrator.
- This action indicates that DCG is in external administration, being insolvent or in financial difficulty.
- The appointed liquidator is Daniel Peter Juratowitch from advisory firm Cor Cordis.
- DCG acquired Lamudi’s businesses in Indonesia and the Philippines in October 2023.
- Previously, in July 2023, Lamudi laid off unspecified employees in Indonesia.

items.title: The women driving SEA’s top startups
items.summary:
- In honor of International Women’s Day, focus on female founders and leaders at SEA’s top companies.
- Lazada raised US$2.1 billion and has four women in leadership.
- Tyme Group leads with six women in top positions across Asia and South Africa.
- The latest list features 66 women, the highest since 2022.

items.title: Meet the 15 top-funded startups and tech companies in Vietnam
Sinar Mas digital arm starts building AI data center
items.summary:
- SM+, the digital infrastructure investment arm of Sinar Mas, begins construction on SMX01 data center for AI technologies.
- Located in Jakarta’s Central Business District, in collaboration with KIRA and LG Sinar Mas.
- Investment exceeds US$300 million, addressing Southeast Asia's digital infrastructure needs, projected market to reach US$1 trillion by 2030.
- Center expected to start operations in the second half of 2026, providing 15,500 sqm of data hall space for 2,400 server racks across nine data halls.
- Will support colocation, hyperscale solutions, and applications for AI and machine learning.

items.title: Reddit introduces new tools to boost compliance, posts
items.summary:
- Reddit launches new features to enhance user compliance with subreddit rules and improve post performance insights.
- New “rules check” tool is being tested on smartphones to help users adhere to subreddit-specific guidelines.
- A post recovery feature allows users to repost content to different subreddits if it is removed for rule violations.
- Reddit plans to provide tailored subreddit recommendations based on post content and clarify posting criteria for specific communities.

items.title: Grab exec departs to lead digital property firm
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Russell Cohen, Grab’s group managing director of operations, has announced his departure after nearly eight years with the company.
- He will return to Melbourne to become CEO of Pexa, a digital property settlement platform.
- Cohen joined Grab in 2017 during its transition from a ride-hailing app to a multi-vertical platform and credited the company’s growth to its culture and values.
- Expressed gratitude to Grab's leadership, team members, and CEO Anthony Tan for their support.
- Grab operates a super app offering ride-hailing, food delivery, and financial services in Southeast Asia.

items.title: Nintendo’s stock falls 8.4% as global investors retreat
items.summary:
[Nintendo's stock has dropped by 8.4% amid investor concerns.]
[Nintendo faces increased scrutiny and retreat from global investors.]
[The decline in stock may impact Nintendo’s market position and future strategies.]

items.title: Trump’s bitcoin reserve cuts $18b pressure, Coinbase exec says
items.author: Conor Grogan
items.summary:
- Conor Grogan from Coinbase estimates Trump's Strategic Bitcoin Reserve may relieve around $18 billion in sell-side pressure.
- Bitcoin’s price fell by 5% following the reserve's announcement, now trading at $85,798.
- The reserve will utilize bitcoins seized from criminal and civil asset forfeitures according to an executive order.
- David Sacks mentioned that the bitcoin will be kept as a store of value rather than being sold.
- Current holdings of the US government include approximately 198,109 bitcoin and 56,035 ethereum.

items.title: BYD launches in Kazakhstan
items.summary:
- BYD officially launched vehicles in Kazakhstan in partnership with Astana Motors.
- Launch events took place in Almaty and Astana, featuring the Han EV sedan and Song Plus models.
- The Han EV includes a blade battery, CTB body integration, 380 kW power, 0-100 km/h in 3.9 seconds, and a range of 565 km with 120 kW fast charging.
- The Song Plus EV has a range of 505–602 km and offers advanced driving assistance, while the plug-in hybrid Song Plus DM-i provides a 150 km electric range and 1,200 km total range.

items.title: Chinese milk tea chain Chagee secures approval for US IPO
items.summary:
- Chagee Holdings Limited has received approval for an overseas IPO from the China Securities Regulatory Commission.
- The company plans to issue approximately 64.7 million common shares and seek a listing on Nasdaq or the New York Stock Exchange within 12 months.
- Founded in 2017 in Kunming, Yunnan, Chagee grew from 1,000 stores in 2022 to 5,699 globally, with over 70% of stores opened in the past two years.

items.title: India gov’t launches AI compute portal, offers subsidies
items.author: Ashwini Vaishnaw
items.summary:
- Union IT minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced initiatives under the 10,300 crore rupee (US$1.1 billion) IndiaAI mission on Mar. 6.
- The IndiaAI compute portal launched to enhance AI development in India.
- The portal will provide cost-effective AI computing resources, networking, storage, and cloud services to startups, researchers, students, and government agencies.
- Eligible users can access services at discounted rates, with a subsidy of up to 40%.
- The portal aims to help lower the costs of developing foundational models compared to other countries.

items.title: Nickel for your thoughts
items.author: Peter
items.summary:
- Nickel is essential for electric vehicle (EV) batteries, with Indonesia producing 61% of the world's refined nickel supply in 2024.
- The nickel mining boom poses environmental and geopolitical challenges, including sustainability issues and supply chain risks due to China's influence.
- Indonesia's role in the nickel market will significantly shape the development of the EV industry going forward.

items.title: 50 rising startups in Vietnam
items.summary:
- A list of startups in Vietnam that have recently raised funding, indicating their potential for growth.
- The focus is on companies up to the series E stage.
- Detailed information about each funding round is included in the list.
